H0.text: Who became the first President of newly independent Ghanain 1957. Kwame Nkrumah's predecessor, Joseph W.S. de Graft-Johnson

H1.text: Who became the first President of newly independent Ghanain 1957. J.B. Danquah

H2.text: Who became the first President of newly independent Ghanain 1957. Emmanuel Obetsebi-Lamptey

H3.text: Who became the first President of newly independent Ghanain 1957. Osagyefo

A4.text: In 1960, Ghanaians approved a new constitution and elected Nkrumah as president.

A5.text: The constitution was ratified and Nkrumah was elected president over J. B. Danquah, the UP candidate, 1,016,076 to 124,623.
